intro: Freirea australis, commonly known as the Australian freirea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry climate of its native habitat. Freirea australis is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited to arid environments.
